County of Marin EMS
April 2025 C 9
ST ELEVATION MYOCARDIAL
INFARCTION (STEMI)
Indications
Patients with acute ST Elevation Myocardial Infarction (STEMI) as identified by machine read
ALS RMC
Unstable?
• SBP <90 prior to NTG & opioid administration
• S/Sx of acute pulmonary edema
Yes No
• Ventricular tachyarrhythmia requiring defibrillation
or anti-arrhythmic therapy
• Patient’s condition based on paramedic judgement
requires immediate hospital intervention
Transport to closest SRC • May go to preferred SRC if the
estimated transport time is not more
than 15 min longer than nearest SRC
• Preferred SRC defined:
• Patient preference
• Provide Early STEMI notification and
• SRC used by treating cardiologist
identifying patient information
• If elevation in leads II, III, and AVF,
suspect RVI and perform a right-
sided EKG
• Provide Early STEMI notification and
• Transmit all STEMI EKGs to SRC if
identifying patient information
possible
• If elevation in leads II, III, and AVF,
suspect RVI and perform a right-
sided EKG
Go to policy: • Transmit all STEMI EKGs to SRC if
possible
Chest Pain/Acute Coronary
Syndrome, C 8
Go to policy:
☎
PHYSICIAN CONSULT Chest Pain/Acute Coronary
Syndrome, C 8
• If patient is symptomatic for STEMI, but monitor
interpretation is not in agreement, transmit EKG
and consult the SRC receiving physician
• If above findings occur, but transmission is not
available, activate SRC with early STEMI notification
